job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
The Software Developer role is a highly technical position that involves designing, testing, implementing, and maintaining our products and internal systems. Developers are expected to be independently motivated, smart, and productive. Developers are involved with, and responsible for, all aspects of the product lifecycle. Developers are expected to be able to quickly solve problems, write maintainable code, and adhere to quality standards. Developers must be able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
This is a permanent full-time position, 100% remote and can be based anywhere in the U.S. Individuals must be authorized to work in the US, no visa sponsorship
QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:
Must have a strong understanding of object oriented principles and design. Should also have experience with scripting languages (PHP, Ruby, Perl, Python), web technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
Must be proficient in database concepts, SQL and familiar with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQLite, MySQL, SQL Server).
Must have experience with Unix/Linux and Windows environments
Clustered or Distributed Computing experience is viewed as a major plus
Ability to establish and maintain a professional working relationship with all levels of staff, Hospital clients and the public.
Experience with unit testing methodologies.
Experience in DevOps tools and practices including CI/CD.
Experience creating and consuming web-based APIs preferably RESTful APIs.
Experience in software design principles, architecture, patterns and practices like SOLID.
Experience in building and maintaining applications in SOA.
Expertise in several J2EE Technologies like JSP, Java Servlet, JDBC, JNDI, JMS, Web Services (SOAP, WSDL, UDDI, REST), XML/XSLT, SAX, DOM, JAXRPC, JAXP, JAXB
Detail oriented with the ability to work with minimum/no supervision.
Ability to understand and follow verbal and written communications.
Demonstrate management and supervisory skills.
Willingness to be a part of a team-unit and cooperate in the accomplishment of departmental goals and objectives.
Perks
Work with a talented team, with plenty of opportunities for professional growth. We offer competitive compensation + benefits that are on par with large companies.
Work anywhere in North America (100% remote)
Monthly stipend for home internet for remote roles
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance
Wellness Incentive to reduce your medical premium!
Health Savings Account / Flexible Spending Account
401(k) with 50% matching up to 6%
'Open PTO Policy' eligible at 90 days of employment
9 Paid Holidays starting Day 1 of employment
Childcare Benefit Program - Tuition discount
Pet Insurance Plans
Nova Southeastern University tuition discount
Short term & Long term disability insurance
